subject: German Perl/Raku Workshop - 2020
header: Last week belonged to German Perl/Raku Workshop - 2020. Luckily there were regular updates on Twitter. Did you notice the change in name? Raku has been added to make it explicit that Perl and Raku both get equal exposure. I am confident we would see flood of event reports by regulars soon.

How can I forget to mention that Curtis Poe who gave keynote presentation through video conferencing about Cor. Well if you don't know what is Cor, then please checkout earlier editiion of PerlWeekly newsletter
Last but not the least, COVID-19, these days everybody is talking about it. Curtis Poe wrote an interesting blog about Coronavirus Fake News. Stay safe and enjoy reading the newsletter

entries.title: Introducing the TPF Community Affairs Team
entries.author: stuart_mackintosh
entries.text: The Perl Foundation is supporting the creation of a Community Affairs Team known as the CAT.

entries.title: Perl Intro Curriculum
entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.text: If we want to attract new people to Perl conferences (and thus Perl), we must make conferences more beginner-friendly.

entries.title: k-Means k-Means-er
entries.author: enkidu
entries.text: As we take another lap around the k-Means race trace, the Porsche 914-2 and Volvo 142E are still neck and neck. This time we'll try a straight-forward normalisation that linearly scales all values to the range [0,1] and see if they still end up in the same cluster.

entries.text: What do you love the most about Linux and freedom of the software?

entries.text: Domm presented this at German Perl/Raku Workshop 2020.

chapters.title: Perl Weekly Challenge
chapters.header: The Perl Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Anwar will help you step out from your comfort-zone. You can even win the prize money of $50 Amazon voucher by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one winner at the end of the month among all the contributors of the month. The monthly prize is kindly sponsored by Peter Sergeant of PerlCareers.

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Don't miss the fun and try new challenges every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge - 050

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Recap of last week challenge. There are plenty of great solutions.
entries.title: RECAP - Perl Weekly Challenge - 050

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Arne shared how to deal with a very large intervals. You will be surprised by the power of Raku.

chapters.title: Perl Tutorial
chapters.header: A section for newbies and for people who need some refreshing of their Perl knowledge. If you have questions or suggestions about the articles, let me know and I'll try to make the necessary changes. The included articles are from the Perl Maven Tutorial and are part of the Perl Maven eBook.
